alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 10:29PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Henry County in southeastern Alabama, Clay, southwestern Randolph, western Calhoun, northern Early and southeastern Quitman Counties in southwestern Georgia through 1100 PM EDT/1000 PM CDT/... At 1029 PM EDT/929 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Fort Gaines, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Gaines, Cuthbert, Edison, Arlington, Bellville, Bluffton, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Parksville, Carnegie, Hayes, Watson Crossroads, Crossroads, Pecan, Randolph Co A/p, Aycock Mill, Morris, Jones Crossing, Bethel and Suttons Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
